isis.stitle: TSI 07-12-05 - Protecting Removed Hydraulically Actuated Fuel Injectors

subjectgroup.subject: Protecting Removed Hydraulically Actuated Fuel Injectors

geninfo.para: Hydraulically actuated fuel injectors, removed for service, must be stored in an oil filled plastic container to increase injector life span.

note.para: Fuel injectors removed from the high-pressure common fuel rail system - in International® MaxxForce™ 7 engines - do not require storage in an oil filled container. For the correct procedure, see the International® MaxxForce™ 7 Service Manual, EGES-345.

step1.para: See Engine Service Manual for removal of hydraulically actuated fuel injectors. Follow the procedure in the manual, but do not put injectors in injector rack cups or leave injectors exposed to air.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, do not clean fuel injectors with parts solvents or chemicals.

step1.para: Follow the procedure in the Engine Service Manual to inspect and service injector O-rings and nozzle gasket.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, put hydraulically actuated fuel injectors in an oil filled closeable plastic container.

step1.para: Put injectors in a closeable plastic container.
Fill container with clean engine oil, covering the injectors.
